snippet: Pilots were dismayed that Boeing did not improve cockpit displays to provide more substantial alerts if the batteries overheated.
abstract: Japanese pilots are nervous about whether they will receive enough warnings about any hazards with new battery systems on Boeing's 787 Dreamliner as aircraft returns to skies after being grounded following two incidents involving smoke or fire; Boeing officials acknowledge they have not expanded alerts, but say new system virtually eliminates such risks to plane.

byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and CHRISTOPHER DREW
byline.contributor: Hiroko Tabuchi reported from Tokyo and Christopher Drew from New York.

lead_paragraph: Pilots were dismayed that Boeing did not improve cockpit displays to provide more substantial alerts if the batteries overheated.

headline.seo: Japanese Pilots Worry About Repaired Boeing 787 Jets
headline.main: Japanese Pilots Worry About Repaired Boeing 787 Jets
headline.print_headline: Japanese Pilots Worry About Repaired Boeing 787 Jets
